benchmark_details.name: DroidCall
benchmark_details.overview: DroidCall is the first training and testing dataset for accurate Android intent invocation, designed to enhance the capabilities of LLMs for mobile agents. It includes 10,000 samples of user instructions paired with corresponding intents, allowing models to effectively learn intent invocation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality dataset for fine-tuning LLMs for accurate intent invocation on Android devices.

data.source: Open-sourced dataset designed specifically for Android intent invocation.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using a data generation pipeline.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated as the ratio of correctly predicted samples to the total number of samples. Soft Accuracy compares the proportion of accurately predicted parameters to the total number of parameters.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy determines the model's performance on matching function calls; higher accuracy indicates better performance in intent invocation.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using 200 test examples from the DroidCall dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User data is processed locally on devices to avoid data transmission risks.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Open-sourced under a permissive license, specific details not provided in the paper.
